default_too_long_summary_msg.title: Summary span too long
default_too_long_summary_msg.text: The highlighted summary span is too long, which can cause missing out little details.

default_redundant_alignment_msg.title: Irrelevant information
default_redundant_alignment_msg.text:
You highlighted redundant information in the document.
Reminder: to un-highlighting - hold ctrl (alt for MacOS) while simultaneously "highlighting".

default_good_summary_span_msg.title: Well Done!
default_good_summary_span_msg.text: The span you chose is very good! Now proceed to find its alignment.

default_good_alignment_msg.title: Good Job!
default_good_alignment_msg.text: The alignment you chose is very good!

submitted_msg.title: You Are All Set!
submitted_msg.text:
Great Job! You are now ready to start annotating.
Hit "ANNOTATION" to begin.
You can also redo the Guided Annotation by pressing "REDO".
Remember: you can always go back to the Tutorial or redo the Guided Annotation if you forget anything, through the navigation bar at the top of the page.

1.title: Very good! You didn't fall for the common trap.

5.title: Good job!
5.text:
As you have probably noticed, "while" is only inferred in the document.
As such, it needs to be submitted with no document alignments.
In this case, it could also make sense to include it in the ensuing span (starting with "stating...").

5.title: Implicit presence of "While"
5.text:
The relation represented by "while" is implicit in the document.
Therefore, there isn't an actual alignment to "while".
So, you can either save it unaligned (by un-highlighting all the document highlightings and hitting the "CONFIRM" button).
Even better, you can include it with the the part of the sentence coming after it ('starting "This bill....'), as this makes the most sense.
If you opt for the second option, and you've already highlighted the part of the sentence coming after, use the "REVISE" option.

2.title: Good span - but be careful
2.text:
The span is borderline - because it covers a lot of details.
make sure you don't miss any detail when you align it.

1.title: Unalignable Summary part
1.text:
Notice that some part of the summary is unalignable (hint: Brazil).
Rarely, you might encounter this.
When you do, align only the alignable parts, and the unalignable ones submit unaligned(by highlighting only the summary information, with no document highlighting, and hitting the "REVISE" button).
